comments:
I created an EMF editor from a simple XSD schema that include xsd:date
attributes. When using the editor to create a new document, a
StringIndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown by selecting the attribute in the
properties view.

This appears to be because XMLTypeFactoryImpl.createDateForString is called
twice - once with null as the value and once with "" as the value.
createDateForString handles a null input by returning null, but it tries to
instantiate a XMLCalendar class for anything else. It's while XMLCalendar is
parsing "" that the StringIndexOutOfBoundsException occurs.

Here's the stacktrace:

Created an attachment (id=18475)
very simple workaround that doesn't pass "" to XMLCalendar's constructor
A fix has been committed to CVS.
